info.game_comments:
1988 Senior Tournament semifinal game 2.
Audio problems with the recording used to archive the game may affect the accuracy of some of the responses.

(1, 1).clue: Once mayor of Buffalo, he started a shipping company with partner Henry Wells

(2, 1).clue: Queen Elizabeth II's personal flag bears a crown with this letter beneath it

(3, 1).clue: Laika, the 1st living creature launched into orbit, was one of these

(4, 1).clue: Julia says to serve this color wine with a cheese souffle

(5, 1).clue: From age 2 to 5, a female horse is a filly; after 5, she's called this

(6, 1).clue: A high-pitched shrill sound, like that of a young bird

(1, 2).clue: Emily Price was better known by this, her married name, which was proper etiquette, of course

(2, 2).clue: Admonition that appeared underneath the rattlesnake on the early U.S. Navy flag

(3, 2).clue: Among the changes in George Jorgensen Jr.'s life was the changing of his 1st name to this

(4, 2).clue: This hot egg yolk & butter sauce is flavored with lemon, unlike its sister "Bearnaise"

(5, 2).clue: In 1919, Man o' War ran & won his 1st race at this Elmont, N.Y. racetrack

(6, 2).clue: For a ballplayer, they can include batting average & RBIs

(1, 3).clue: The name of this family of bankers came from a sign on their house bearing a red shield

(2, 3).clue: By regulation, when Old Glory is completely folded, it's in this shape

(3, 3).clue: To avoid being linked with communism, this Major League Baseball team changed its name

(4, 3).clue: Her version of moussaka is this vegetable filled with onions, herbs, garlic, & ground roast leg of lamb

(5, 3).clue: Popular California track operated by the Los Angeles Turf Club

(6, 3).clue: Of the common nicknames for Richard, Robert or Ronald, the one which is a palindrome

(2, 4).clue: U.S. cabinet department whose flag features a buffalo in the center

(3, 4).clue: (AUDIO DAILY DOUBLE) According to Cash Box, she had the biggest hit of 1951 with the following: "I remember the night and the Tennessee Waltz..."

(4, 4).clue: The most famous French beef stew, it uses wine as a simmering liquid

(5, 4).clue: All thoroughbred racehorses trace their ancestry back to 3 males of this breed

(6, 4).clue: It's the Chinese lunar new year as celebrated in Southeast Asia

(1, 5).clue: When Italy entered WWI, he assumed charge of the government's wireless service

(2, 5).clue: Symbol found on the national flags of the Maldives, Tunisia & Pakistan

(3, 5).clue: Newsweek says regional accents began to fade away in the U.S. due to the influence of this

(4, 5).clue: For easy opening, set them curved side down on a electric burner & in a minute the shells begin to part

(5, 5).clue: The term for a horse's probable odds as figured by the track handicapper & printed in the program

(1, 1).clue: He was the leader of China for the duration of the war

(2, 1).clue: They're the respiratory organs of a lobster

(4, 1).clue: In opera titles, this word precedes "Carlos", "Giovanni", "Pasquale", & "Pedro"

(5, 1).clue: Though some have several, most mosques have at least 1 of these towers to call people to prayer

(6, 1).clue: Frank Sinatra & Andrew Previn, but not Woody Allen

(2, 3).clue: Of light, oxygen, or moisture, the one most plant seeds don't need in order to germinate
